title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that neither country has an absolute advantage in producing coconuts and/or does not explain that the two countries produce the same amount of coconuts (50 tons) using the same amount of resources.

The response states that neither country has an absolute advantage in producing coconuts and explains that the two countries produce the same amount of coconuts (50 tons) using the same amount of resources.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Freshland has a comparative advantage in producing coconuts and/or does not explain that Freshland has a lower opportunity cost in producing coconuts than Zeetopia [Freshland’s opportunity cost of producing one ton of coconuts is 0.6 ton of mangoes ( 30/50=0.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF0@ ), whereas Zeetopia’s opportunity cost of producing one ton of coconuts is 1.2 tons of mangoes ( 60/50=1.2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF0@ )].

The response states that Freshland has a comparative advantage in producing coconuts and explains that Freshland has a lower opportunity cost in producing coconuts than Zeetopia [Freshland’s opportunity cost of producing one ton of coconuts is 0.6 ton of mangoes ( 30/50=0.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF0@ ), whereas Zeetopia’s opportunity cost of producing one ton of coconuts is 1.2 tons of mangoes ( 60/50=1.2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF0@ )].

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state yes and/or does not explain that these are mutually beneficial terms of trade because they lie between the opportunity costs for both islands (0.6 and 1.2 tons of mangoes). [In order for the terms of trade to be beneficial to both parties, they must fall between the opportunity costs of the two countries (i.e., between 0.6 and 1.2 tons of mangoes).]

The response states that yes, the terms of trade are mutually beneficial because they lie between the opportunity costs for both islands (0.6 and 1.2 tons of mangoes). [In order for the terms of trade to be beneficial to both parties, they must fall between the opportunity costs of the two countries (i.e., between 0.6 and 1.2 tons of mangoes).]

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not draw a correctly labeled graph (see graph below) showing Zeetopia’s PPC and Freshland’s PPC and showing the correct quantity of coconuts on the horizontal axis and the correct quantities of mangoes on the vertical axis.

The response draws a correctly labeled graph (see graph below) showing Zeetopia’s PPC and Freshland’s PPC and showing the correct quantity of coconuts on the horizontal axis and the correct quantities of mangoes on the vertical axis.

title: Part (e)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Students must have correctly drawn the graph in part D in order to earn the point in part E. Point X can be plotted anywhere in the area above Freshland’s PPC and below Zeetopia’s PPC but not on either of the islands’ PPCs.
descriptions: The response does not show point X plotted in the area above Freshland’s PPC and below Zeetopia’s PPC (see graph below).
The response shows point X plotted in the area above Freshland’s PPC and below Zeetopia’s PPC (see graph below).
